meanings.definition: A cast or tinge of color.
meanings.sent1: The artist used different colorcasts to create a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent2: The sunset had a warm colorcast that painted the sky in shades of orange and pink.
meanings.sent3: The colorcasts in the garden made the flowers look like a rainbow.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had a joyful colorcast that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The colorcast of the autumn leaves was a stunning display of nature's beauty.

meanings.definition: To give a particular color to.
meanings.sent1: She colorcasts the walls with a fresh coat of paint every spring.
meanings.sent2: The artist decided to colorcast the background in shades of blue to enhance the portrait.
meanings.sent3: He colorcasts his food with different sauces to make them more appetizing.
meanings.sent4: The setting sun colorcasts the sky with hues of red and gold.
meanings.sent5: The rainbow colorcasts the sky after a refreshing rain shower.

meanings.definition: A film or layer of material that changes the color of light passing through it.
meanings.sent1: The sunglasses had a colorcast that made everything appear slightly tinted.
meanings.sent2: The camera lens filter had a blue colorcast that affected the overall tone of the photograph.
meanings.sent3: The magician's glasses had a mysterious colorcast that added to his illusion tricks.
meanings.sent4: The stained glass window had a beautiful colorcast that painted the church in vibrant hues.
meanings.sent5: The theater lights had a subtle colorcast that set the mood for the performance.
